e4: As a board member, it would be strongly recommended to adopt a more transparent financial reporting policy and disclose the true earnings per share to all investors. Although switching policies may affect short-term market fluctuations in stock prices, long term value creation can likely be achieved and market confidence and trust should remain a focal aspect of a corporation's priority. Legal ramifications should also serve as an incentive for reporting accurate EPS figures. Any initial downward adjustment can be made gradually over time to mitigate negative effects on small retail investors, who are ultimately the stakeholders impacted by the unrealistic financial expectations set forth in current policy.
e5: For a reporting policy to be considered ethical, it should comply with financial regulations and provide transparency around all business transactions. The earnings should accurately reflect business performance in a timely manner to serve as guidance for investors. Any discrepancies between reported figures can expose firms to potential legal ramifications and damage long-term reputation with the investor community. Furthermore, such practices have the potential to harm stakeholders, specifically retail investors who invest based on their perception of financial health, creating an unbalanced playing field between them and more sophisticated hedge funds. In light of this complex landscape, the characteristics I would prioritize as ethical for reporting policy in ABC company would involve a commitment to credible communication with all stakeholders while adhering to legal guidelines to ensure accurate financial portrayals and minimize potential disproportionate impacts on specific investors.
e6: While appreciating various considerations raised by CFO such as investor dynamics, regulatory risks and market implications, I would probingly inquire whether management is proactively monitoring changes in regulatory environment to ensure consistent compliance with SEC guidelines or seeking legal advice for more detailed insights into the consequences of switching policies to prevent exacerbating short-term fluctuations. Furthermore, exploring possibilities of staggering change implementation timeline and conducting extensive communication strategy to ensure consistent messaging to investor audience may help lessen negative market reactions that result from unrealized growth expectations. Lastly, delving deeper into hedge fund tactics employing informed advantages could inform potential strategies mitigating unequal treatment of small investors.
